name: Izakaya MEW
address: 53 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

I wouldnâ€™t even give this place one star.
I placed my order at 12:00, and it said it would arrive by 1:08 â€” but it didnâ€™t arrive until 3:10!
How can you make someone wait for food for three hours? This is absolutely unacceptable.
I even paid extra for express delivery, yet it still came this late.
I contacted DoorDash and even called the restaurant, but no one picked up the phone.
If youâ€™re going to run your business like this, you might as well not run it at all.
Stop ruining peopleâ€™s day with such terrible service.

I used to love Izakaya Mew, but tonight was beyond disappointing. The staff rushed us to pay mid-meal, and after I paid, one of them ran up saying he lost my card - then quite literally vanished. No urgency, no apology, just confusion while they kept serving others. After what felt like forever, they threw my card back without a word. When I finally asked what happened, all I got was, â€œIt was a misunderstanding.â€ Absolutely unprofessional, careless, and disrespectful.

Hidden Gem In Manhattan ğŸ’
This Place Blows My Mind ğŸ¤¯
The Dishes Are Delicious & Creative ğŸ˜
I Came Here With A Group Of 5 & We Literally Ordered Every Thing Of The Menu.
Spectacular Service ğŸ«¶
Definitely Recommend ğŸ‘

ğŸœ I had the most delicious kimchi cream udon! The noodles were thoughtfully cut short, so you donâ€™t have to slurp them up or bite them short. I also love that they offer mocktail versions of the drinks.

ğŸª‘Very loud! It might be overwhelming for a first date, but good for meeting up with friends who are willing to shout over everyone else.

ğŸ§I was a little put off by the waiter wearing shorts, but live your best life, king, lol!

Absolut zu empfehlen. Auf der Suche nach einem New Yorker Sushi Ausflug, sind wie hier fÃ¼ndig geworden. Nachdem wir fast daran vorbeigelaufen wÃ¤ren, haben wir den Kellerabgang gefunden.

Freundlicher Service, gute und ausreichende Auswahl und faire Preise.

Ein Manko vielleicht - das gebotene stille Wasser - ein Ausflug ins Chlorwasserâ€¦ Die Cola als Alternative - zwar auch anders, aber ohne Chlor.

used to love this place and take a seat whenever i can. would always recommend to friends whenever they ask recommendations to the city but after my visit today, i have noticed several things factors that will never bring me back here.

the great deal for fresh raw seafood is no longer a deal. the cost is up (they now use their brunch menu for their dinners, meaning the meals are pricier for less) and the food portions has gone down. the raw salmon no longer tastes as fresh, but i can't say for sure about the other menu items. the service has gotten so bad, with nobody checking in, and the one time they did, they were rushing us to leave. while i understand they are busy, your business should accomodate for 4 customers staying at least an hour for the meal. one of our friends got her meal 30 minutes after us, yet she was rushed to finish, badgered by a waiter asking her "are you finished?" despite half of her bowl still being there. this was after 50 minutes of being seated. we ended up leaving right after that since she felt ashamed for making the waiters upset, but this is not the way you should be treating your customers. i understand the price hikes but you have to expect your customers to enjoy their meals and meet their loved ones over dinner for at least an hour.

just be mindful of where you choose to spend your money. there are great meals everywhere else in the city.

A friend of mine suggested this place since he's already been before. He made a reservation for six on a Friday night. I loved the vibes and atmosphere. Everything we ordered was fantastic. They also offer some pretty fun, mocktails, perfect since many of us do not drink. Service was fast and efficient. I would definitely come back.

Really worth the long wait. The first thing we had was the mackerel, some of the best I had. I wonder if that sauce would go well with rice. Chicken nanban is a must get. The sauce is amazing either succulent chicken. Niku tofu, really good for sharing, warms you right up, delicious. Pork Katsu was great, but my friend said the pork was dry which I thought was moist. It was incredibly loud, somewhat hard to talk but I think it makes a pretty good date place.

We feel like we struck gold when we found Izakaya MEW. You'll find yourself describing these foods later. The people here display extraordinary warmth. I'm skeptical about the authenticity of this restaurant's praise. This spot showed thorough attention to quality.
Perfect, a little bit louder than usual but Udon was delicious ğŸ¤¤  and sakes

Great food, great service, kind of noisy, so just know that you have to yell to be able to say anything. But food is definitely worth the wait, and worth visiting. Reservation required. I would recommend it 100%
The food was great, service amazing! Will come back

ES LAMENTABLE LO DE LA PROPINA. OJO!! TE LA EXIGEN E INTENTAN INTIMIDARTE. LA COMIDA REGULAR Y EL SERVICIO NEFASTO. NO VOLVEREMOS.
OJO CON LA CUENTA.

Generally very reasonably priced with. Lot of Japanese pub food. The portions are fair. I recommend going with a small group so you can try/share things. The okonomiaki was pretty large. The mushrooms truffle ramen was very rich. The sushi rolls were yummy but hot dishes are a better value of food quantity for the money.
incredible food and service!!
The most delicious meal I have had in NYC ever! Everything was amazing! And the service was top notch

The food - especially the kimchi cream noodle - was great, but the atmosphere and ambience was very off. It was very loud, they were blasting loud K-Pop music and the waiters were shouting, making the atmosphere very tiring and overwhelming
The service is great and quick! no long waits. The drinks are all well balanched and good. The kimchi ramen is amazing. I will be coming back

I went there with 3 more workmates for lunch. Must say food was good. From the beggining we realised they dont accept to pay by apple pay. Just cash or physical cards. 3 of us left our physical corporate cards at the office so we asked if possible to pay by our phones. The guy told us they could so there wasnt a problem at all. The thing is later, when we ask for paying equally by our devices, the guy told us they couldnt make that, just with the physical card is allowed. We got confused why they accept to pay by our devices but not split equally the check. The manager came with the same thing. They split just with the physical but with the devices they do not split but even they didnt allow us to come back with physical as requested from the beggining.

Obviously, last time!
Great food, great service. Do yourself a favor and go get you some Izakaya ğŸ˜â€¦
Fun spot with Izakaya classics on the menu. The waitstaff was a lot of fun and obviously cared about our experience.

This place gets packed for lunch and for good reason. Food is excellent, service quick and vibe is great. Itâ€™s a hidden gem downstairs and can be hard to find. I would definitely love to keep this one a secret but itâ€™s way too late for that!
Fantastic  high quality Japanese food. Very good and quick service. We were pleasantly surprised how little we spent.

The pleasant surprise of this place made my whole day better. This restaurant provided a spellbinding evening! The dish balanced freshness with lemon complexity. What's more, workers here displayed both warmth and accommodation. This place meets its goals perfectly.
I recommend the yellow tail and the kalbi beef.
waiter so rude and disrespectful, when the entire restaurant is EMPTY, canâ€™t even order a drink and sit by the bar before everyone arrives

We recently dined at this Japanese restaurant and overall had a wonderful experience! The dishes were flavorful, beautifully presented, and full of savory goodness. Every plate brought something unique to the table â€” from the perfectly seasoned fried rice topped with an onsen egg, to the rich and satisfying omusoba drizzled with mayo and okonomiyaki sauce, and the crunchy sushi rolls bursting with freshness and texture. The tempura avocado tacos were a fun and creative twist, and the cheese fries offered a comforting, cheesy bite.

The restaurant itself had a cozy and welcoming atmosphere, and the staff were attentive â€” they checked in several times to ensure our food arrived properly and that we were satisfied, which we really appreciated.

However, we did find the cheese fries a bit too greasy and heavy, leaving a noticeable oily aftertaste. That was the only dish that didnâ€™t quite meet the high standard of the others.
Another small disappointment was being charged $1.50 extra for hot sauce â€” it was unexpected and felt a bit unnecessary for such a simple request.

Despite these minor issues, the food was overall delicious and savory, and the service was kind and attentive. If not for the extra charge for the hot sauce and the overly oily fries, weâ€™d gladly give them a full 5 stars. Still, this is a place weâ€™d happily return to for another flavorful meal!

One of the best Izakaya in the city for both quality/variety of food, and reasonable prices. Located downstairs and always packed with diners. Seasonal specials like scallop skewers and regular items tartare, mentaiko udon, crudo & basque cheesecake all top notch. It was quite loud due to the packed seating and service a bit slow.

There was already a line before they opened, and it made sense why. Their staffs were super friendly. Food was a delight, I was surprised by their options and inexpensive prices. Iâ€™m definitely a regular here now.
Just incredible on all levels, eclectic interior, friendly staff, incredible food, quick service and super reasonable prices.  4 guys 2 drinks about 12 dishes and desert and it was $230 before top.

We came here on a date night and were really disappointed. We were told it would be a 30-minute wait for a table, but ended up waiting over an hour. Staff later claimed they had texted us, but no message ever came through.

When we finally sat down, the food itself tasted good (sushi, fried rice, and ribs), but partway through the meal we found a roach crawling on our table near the food. We let the server know, and the manager only offered 15% off. When my date pushed back, the staff laughed and told us to leave instead of addressing the situation seriously.

Between the long wait, poor communication, unsanitary conditions, and unprofessional response, I cannot recommend this restaurant.

I definitely do not recommend this place!!!!!
I came back because I really enjoyed it the last time, but today I was completely disappointed. They changed the menu, and when I told the waiter that Iâ€™m sensitive to spicy food and canâ€™t eat anything hot, she said the only option was the salmon roll. When I asked what was in the salmon roll, his answer was just â€œsalmon.â€ I also asked about common rolls that every sushi place usually has, like a California roll or something similar, and she said they didnâ€™t have any. I ended up not being able to eat anything.
My friend ordered the special roll, but what they brought out was stale sushiâ€”just something fried and thrown on a plate! Honestly, I will never come back here again.
Excellent food. Always fresh and so tasty! Fast service and good sake selection.
MEW is legitimately 5 stars in all three categories of Food, Service and Atmosphere.

Delicious food!! Definitely recommend the spare ribs soooo juicy as well as the Omu soba!! I suspect all there food is delicious!
My favorite go to stop. If can reserve pleas so because itâ€™s a long wait. This time we waited 45 mins. Reservation like 2 days before.

Atmosphere:  VERY LOUD (you have to raise your voice for the other person to hear)
Wish it wasnâ€™t so loud but the food is SO WORTH IT!

Temp: just right
MÃ¼kemmel japon burasÄ± siyah kapÄ±dan aÅŸaÄŸÄ±da. fiyatlarÄ± da baya ucuz.

Left 0 tip and they charged me 18% automatically. Savages.

Left 0 tip because they took my place away so quickly that I couldnâ€™t even have the chance to say  â€œIâ€™m still working on itâ€. Unbelievably barbarians

Food is okay though ramen is a disaster.

Rude front desk, rude service overallâ€¦
Delicious, fast service, but super noisy environment and can be long wait during rush hour

Never noticed this basement eatery nestled between two Korean restaurants. Busy for a weekday lunch but it was only a short wait for a table. Lunch service ends pretty early at 2.15pm.

Prices were very reasonable. Portions were hearty. Service was prompt and efficient. No snooty waitstaff, more of a teamwork sort of effort.

Great find.

Mains came with a delicious spicy tofu appetizer and miso soup.

Pork rice with egg - pork was decently tender. Rice was a little stuck together. But overall the parts worked well together: soft onsen egg, crunchy cabbage slivers, pork with sauce and white rice.

Omu soba - very delicious. Not too heavy for fried food. Egg is perfectly soft. Noodles with crunchy cabbage slices were moreish.

Okay for those of you who are not a native to NYC like me. This place is absolutely easy to miss, especially at night. Look for the black awning stuffed between two other restaurants. See attached photo. Go down, sit down and enjoy.
Just to forewarn itâ€™s a bit noisy for date night and can be a bit crowded like you see in the attached video. We were there during the week. Well worth the experience and wait.

Would give negative star if it's possible. The worse thing was they spelled whole bowl of boiling hot ramen on me and didn't apologize about it, you can tell they don't really care. NEVER again.

I went there because of all the good reviews and the variety of the menu. First, the service is rude and rushed , but to be fair I think they need more staff. Second, food is not great and not as what they show in pictures. Only two thin and small slices of pork in ramen and the skewers combo was not cook from scratch. It was clearly precook food and they just microwave with the sauce.
Cocina oculta repleta de sabores, calidad de productos y buena tÃ©cnica. Ultra recomendable!

Izakaya MEW was without a doubt our best meal in the city this round. Everything we had was a 10!

My best advice is go all in and SHARE everything! Try it all!
Udon was creamy but I didnâ€™t really taste the kimchi and the miso soup was good

Busy and lively basement izakaya. The Yuzu Kiki cocktail was nice, kind of like a sparkling margarita. Food was just average, more like cafeteria dishes. The Frozen Kirin Beer looked cool but wasnâ€™t cold enough and didnâ€™t taste great. Each dish is cheap, and most of the guests looked pretty young. Fun vibe if you like crowds, but not really for the food.
Love everything here!
Sometimes I think about these creamy udon and I want to cry...so good I came back a few times just for them !
Very tasty and friendly staff. An exceptional great value for NYC.

I regret that the name reminded me to keep my lookmaxxing streak going - so I had to stay silent instead of giving my compliments to the chefs in person ğŸ¤«ğŸ“ Fresh from a visit to Japan, my companion and I were craving Japanese bar food, and Izakaya Mew did not disappoint. We ordered a grilled fish dish that was so good it was gone before the phone could even eat first- I think it was cod, but Iâ€™m not sure - it was served in bite size pieces and garnished with a savory & citrusy sauce + plenty of fresh herbs. The okonomiyaki was great as well - if a bit richer than whatâ€™s available in Japan. Not that I minded - just a warning that itâ€™s quite filling! The atmosphere was great and reminded me of my travels. The service was attentive to my group and to detail :)

I visited Friday night. Restaurant was at underground and entrance was so small, so it was not easy to find to way in.
I couldn't expect but it was Friday night, so there were very crowded with many travelers who came from other countries. Waiting space wasn't big and even waiting members were many, so our group waited for keep standing 2 hours 7 pm to 9 pm. Restaurant not so big either. Price wasn't high as well as the quality.

The food here really impressed us, some of the best Japanese dishes weâ€™ve had in a while. Everything was fresh, well-balanced, and full of flavour. It was definitely on the loud side inside, but once the food arrived, we didnâ€™t mind at all. A great spot if you care more about taste than quiet.

A must-visit for sushi lovers. We waited nearly 30 minutes to be seated at Izakaya Mew, but every bite made it worth the wait.

The entrance is unassumingâ€”you head down a set of stairs with no flashy signsâ€”but inside is a buzzing, tightly packed space filled with energy. The atmosphere is minimal yet vibrant, clearly loved by locals and visitors alike.

We tried the Mew Special, Volcano Roll, Dynamite Roll, and Black Dragon Rollâ€”each one thoughtfully prepared, balanced, and full of flavor. Nigiri pieces were also excellent, with perfectly seasoned rice and fresh cuts of fish.

Service isnâ€™t super fast, but dishes come out with care and attention. Itâ€™s clear the kitchen prioritizes quality over speed, which we appreciated.
We had a great family dinner and will definitely come backâ€”with a reservation next time.

We went for lunch. We got seated quickly on a weekday. I used to make reservations online but found that we were still accommodated when we just went there. Service was efficient.
About the menu, noticed accompanying sides changed over time but the food/sets are delicious and very satisfying at great prices. I tried the Tokachi butadon and didn't expect the pork belly to be so soft that I actually said it was melt-in-my-mouth-tender.

Love Izakaya MEW.

The tapas style dishes are perfectly portioned to order plenty and share. Must try is the kimchi creamy udon, itâ€™s so good!

Service was good, theyâ€™re constantly busy especially during rush hour, so itâ€™s quick and easy.

Atmosphere can be a bit overwhelming. Itâ€™s a smaller space so itâ€™s very loud and limited space.

I've been wanting to try this spot for a while, so I was super excited when I came here with one of my friends for dinner. The door can be a bit hard to miss as it's hidden between Cho Dang Gol and Han bat, but it's just right there! You go down a staircase to enter and inside, there's lots of tables and space for groups of different sizes. Service here is super quick.

My friend and I got their hamachi tataki, omu soba, and kimchi cream udon. The hamachi tataki was good, but nothing crazy. I really liked both of our entrees though. The omu soba was flavorful and full of pork belly and topped with delicious eggs, sauce, and bonito flakes. And, the kimchi cream udon had seafood, mushrooms, and was creamy and rich. Would love to come back here to try some of their other items!

Hear me outâ€¦the food was delicious and arrived quickly, which we appreciated. However, we informed our server of a serious food allergy and specifically asked to be told if any of our dishes contained the allergen. When the first dish came out, we spotted the allergen ourselves and asked for it to be removed.

Halfway through the meal, the server returned and admitted that other items we had already eaten also contained the allergen. We expressed our concern to the manager, who simply smiled, explained that the server was new, and walked away. We paid our bill in full and left unwell and extremely disappointed.

This is a very good Korean bbq restaurant.
The food is amazing and it is a whole experience have e selection of dishes cooked at your table.
The menu is very good. From sashimi and wagyu tartare to bbq skewers and so on.
All the dishes we had were just amazing.
You order from a tablet at your table.  Which eliminates the interaction with a server.  But nonetheless the experience was awesome
Wish some of the menu items had a little bit of description since it is already digital.
The place was really noisy. Well I guess it was just the noisy patrons
But all in all a great experience and absolutely amazing food.

MEW is near my office, so I have been going for lunch and dinner for more than 10 years since 2013 when MEW opened. I'm grateful for providing delicious food at the same place for a long time. All dishes are very tasty! Una don is my favorite in Summer!

Absolutely delicious! Highly recommend the kimchi cream udonâ€”so rich and flavorfulâ€”and the gyu don and zuke salmon donburi, both packed with savory depth. The gyoza and yellowtail carpaccio were also standoutsâ€”fresh, well-balanced, and beautifully presented. Iâ€™d personally skip the omu soba and hotate carpaccio, which didnâ€™t quite hit the mark for me. Great customer service and a warm, welcoming atmosphere made the experience even better. Will definitely be coming back!

Izakaya Mew always hits the spot. We ordered from their lunch special and were so impressed! Everything was super fresh, flavorful, and nicely portioned. The prices are very reasonable for the quality youâ€™re getting. The space has a cool, modern vibe with good lighting, and the staff made the whole experience even better with how friendly and attentive they were. Iâ€™d definitely recommend checking it out, especially for lunch, their lunch menu is a total win.

Awesome vibes, friendly staff, delicious food and drinks. Our first time dining here was a hit. Got there a little after they opened up for dinner without a reservation on a weekday and got seated right away. Everyone is super nice and the atmosphere is fun and chill. Their When Bayberry Blooms cocktail is delicious and pretty. Definitely recommend the scallop skewers with uni butter. Absolutely phenomenal and could eat a dozen lol their creamy kimchi udon noodles were surprisingly light and not too heavy as you would expect from a cream based dish. They have a seared salmon nigiri that is pure perfection and melts in your mouth. Will be coming back for sure to try more of their menu.

Now for my standard comments. Location is down some stairs and in a basement area. Do not think I saw a handicap friendly way down there. The interior is clean and well kept. A bit tight but still very comfortable to dine in.

Small bites over large portionsâ€”every time.
If youâ€™re someone who lives for flavor-packed dishes meant for sharing, this hidden NYC spot is calling your name. Every single plate felt like it was crafted to nourish not just your appetite, but your soul.

Best $$$$ spentâ€”without breaking the bank.
Itâ€™s not expensive, but every bite is cooked to absolute perfection. Perfect for a first dateâ€”affordable, cozy, and made for sharing stories over shared plates.

Unbelievably tasty and unique food, quick and wonderful service, and fun vibe. By far the best find in New York. Seriously soooo so so good. I donâ€™t usually care to leave reviews but this was amazing! Got the creamy kimchi noodles, the omelette soba noodles, ribs, and basque cheesecake. Everything was perfect.

I hate to say that I love this place (because I love Korean restaurants more than anything ^^).

I came here 3 times within 10 days since I was introduced to this place by one of my colleagues.

I love Sushi, Salman Teishoku, and Saba Teishoku. I will visit again until I taste most of the dishes on the menu.

There are two things that I hope they can improve: 1) too noisy music,  2) sticky table.

i really liked the food here the service was really fast my favorite was the carbonara noodles so slay didn't really like the egg soba noodles tho those were too much and the chicken was pretty filling we got to get a reservation too which was nice

WOW! Found this through TikTok, and we were amazed by the quality of service. The food was superb, and I wish we could've taken some home. We traveled to NYC to visit, and we will def be back again!  Must try the Kimchi Cream Udon (not pictured).

Stop gatekeeping this hidden gem!! Saw this place on Instagram and decided to go here after a trip to midtown. Located in a basement, the interior of the restaurant is well themed and homey.

The prices are super reasonable (hard to find in NY now days) and they have a wide variety of menu items, ranging from ramen to fried chicken dishes. The service is impeccable as always and we will definitely return!
Haven't been to izakaya in a few years.  The quality from the first time I went was superb, again after a few years the quality is still outstanding! The food itself very flavorful.

This restaurant is in a basement and itâ€™s kind of hard to spot. The vibe is fine, just your usual underground izakaya vibe. But is SUPER packed. The food is good. I like the teriyaki avocado I got. I came here for the cream udon which was quite good. The only thing is the waiter didnâ€™t ask for my allergy and it turned out it had shrimps in the udon which I am allergic to. He replaced it with a new one without shrimp but itâ€™d have been great if he asked first.

Izakaya MEW has a cool underground vibe and itâ€™s a fun place to chill with friends. I ordered the fried chicken, kimchi cream udon, and okonomiyaki and everything was really good. The food felt super authentic and full of flavor. The kimchi udon was probably my favorite with that creamy spicy combo. Drinks were tasty too and paired well with the food. It does get busy so a reservation is a good idea if you donâ€™t want to wait. Overall I had a great time here and Iâ€™d definitely come back for another round.

Very delicious food, interesting atmosphere. Should book in advance, otherwise youâ€™ll need to stand in line, but the good thing is that the line is very quick.
Then they will seat you, the service is very quick, the food comes momentarily, they try to clean your table asap even if you still have a bite in your plate, so be ready to protect your dish lol.

Even though the service is very brisk and youâ€™re feeling a bit rushed, the food is very good.
Oh, also make sure youâ€™re wearing something light or have a little portable fan with you, because thereâ€™s no A/C.

Definitely would recommend for a quick good food and authentic atmosphere âœ¨

This place is always packed for a reason, and it's because of their delicious food and very affordable prices! The Taki Wasa is raw octopus with a wasabi marinade - it's worth trying, as long as you're comfortable with raw seafood texture (similar to raw scallops), and it pairs very well with the crispy seaweed! The Amakara Ribs were super tender and sweet! The Salmon Don became a go-to for me based on how good it was + you can't beat this price - anywhere else, this dish would've easily costed more.

We finally tried this Japanese restaurant right next to our hotel after noticing the constant crowd gathered outside every night. The wait was over an hour, but once we were seated downstairs, we were greeted warmly and felt right at home.

I went with my fiancÃ© and our son, and we decided to try a variety of dishes since everything was portioned small and perfect for sharing. We ordered the ramen, chicken nanban, kani cream croquettes, and a California roll for our son. Each dish was absolutely delicious.

We also sampled a couple of their cocktails, which were just as thoughtfully crafted. The vibe of the place was lively but cozy, and the staff was kind and attentive.
The wait may be long but it was totally worth it. Highly recommend stopping by if youâ€™re in the area!

A restaurant that serves excellent Japanese food!
The atmosphere is great, the staff is very attentive, and the food is delicious â€“ all the dishes were tasty, large, and worth the price.
The cocktails were really good too.
Anyone in the area who wants to experience a Japanese vibe in New York, I highly recommend visiting.
The restaurant is located on the basement level (-1).
Itâ€™s advisable to make a reservation in advance or expect to wait about 30 minutes for a table.

There is absolutely nothing about the food here that I donâ€™t like. As a devoted fan of Japanese cuisine, I can confidently say that this restaurant offers truly authentic dishes that make me feel as though Iâ€™m dining in Tokyo itself. The atmosphere is incredibly relaxed and inviting, providing the perfect setting for a memorable meal.

I would like to extend a special thanks to Sara for accommodating my request to reschedule my reservation. Her exceptional customer service made my experience even more enjoyable. In fact, I was so impressed that I made another reservation before my trip back to my country.

This place has definitely earned a spot on my list of favorites!
